title: The Whale
description: The office trains Dwight to sell to a female client without being offensive, only to discover that the client is Jan Levinson. Angela and Oscar both think the senator is cheating on them, and Jim has trouble on an important conference call.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on computer screen] Ah, what else? I've seen Dirty Dancing like, ten times.  Breaks my heart every time, you know?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That Swayze sure can dance dirty.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Don't you have any sunblock?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, Walter J has been hoarding it. You want to worry about a part of my body, worry about my eyes.  They're like two flaming meatballs in my skull.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Last week Andy set sail for the Bahamas to sell his family's boat, and he took his brother, but not me. I was kind of sad at first, but then I remembered that Bob Marley song -- No, woman. No cry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on computer] Check this out. Keeps my hair out of my stare, also helps me combat the glare bear. That's what I call the sun now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy, it's Darryl. Take your drawers off your head.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What else can I show you? Oh, damn it!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, Andy, was.. was that your drinking water?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, it was. That's okay though. I got this cool desalinator device. It sucks up sea water through this hose and pumps out fresh water. See, check it out.  Ow!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah! That's not good. I better sign off. I hate to get going. I mean these skype sessions are, like, the only thing that keep me sane out here, you know? [laughs crazily]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: He's been sailing for two days.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on computer] I will leave you with this. The image of a man and his boat. Burn this into your brains.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [laughing] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. No! Nooo! [computer falls into ocean]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy? Andy! Andy! Andy. Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [answering phone] Dwight Schrute. [turns on speakerphone] Well, hi there David Wallace. Why would you ever call me when the manager is out of town?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Well, I have some very exciting news.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you didn't call Jim - that seems significant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim, good! You should hear this too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, he shouldn't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [taking away Dwight's handset] Go ahead David, I'm listening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, David, I want to take you off speaker but... I don't know where I'd put you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Guys, listen, this is big news. The Scranton White Pages just got in contact with my office the day before yesterday. They've apparently just dropped the supplier they've been with for the last ten years. .

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The White Pages.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The White Pages: Do you want it? No. Do you use it? No. Does it inexplicably show up on your doorstep three times a year? Yes, yes, and yes. There's a reason that we in the paper industry call this thing "the White Whale". Look at all that sweet blubber.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Look, we need our top salesman running point on this and Dwight, that is you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna need to put you on hold for a second. [presses hold button] Hah! Yah! Woooo! Eat it Jim! Eat it Phyllis! Eat... where's Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's in the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Will you run into the bathroom and tell him to eat it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! Okay. [presses button again] Hey David, I'm back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [from the kitchen] Eat it Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So uh, last I remember Tom Peterman was in charge of that account?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, I spoke with the receptionist over there. It's someone new but she didn't catch her name.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Her name?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, hey, Dwight shouldn't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shhh! [clears throat] Thanks David! Thank you so much for calling me!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Good luck!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good luck to you. [disconnects call]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight, you can't go. You have a problem with women. You can't sell to them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is a damnable lie. I love women.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Gina Rogers at Apex Technology said you called her 'gy-na' for your entire meeting.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ew. That's not good.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, she said she corrected him five times.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: 'Gy-na' said that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Guys, we can't let Dwight blow this. An account this size could double our growth. That means raises, bonuses... Pizza Friday could come back.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey remember that week in the 90's when we got bagels?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I miss Clinton.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you go instead?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't. I have the thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have this conference call today with this company in Philly that I'm helping start. Ah, first board meeting. Also, the first time I've ever been excited about work. So, that feels... wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Okay, call down. It's just me, not Tom Selleck.

quotes.speaker: Guys in breakroom
quotes.text: [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Toby got us all to participate in Movember. It's a charity for prostate cancer. You pledge money and then you grow a mustache for the month of November.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So, this is how we look now. I hope you like being turned on all the time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Daaaaamn! It just keeps on coming, huh?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I have very fertile hair glands.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I am so glad I got all of the dudes to do Movember. We have the dopest time back in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: God!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We even go to lunch, pick up babes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to passing female pedestrian] Smile if you love men's prostates.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Spring cleaning?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: More like fall cleaning. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [whispering] I think the senator is having an affair.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [dropping desk drawer] This doesn't... I'm sorry. Wha... what?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think the senator is having an affair.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I literally have nightmares in which what just happened happens. I wake up in a sweat. And then I make Angela's husband spoon me back to bed.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: When he comes home in the morning, he has this secret little smile.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sure ...that's nothing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And he's always at the yoga studio. He never misses the noon class - it's Hot Yoga with Blake.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, Blake's also a guy's name so he... may be spending his afternoons with a guy named Blake. So nothing to worry about. Huh. Blake. Who is Blake?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I just never heard about the senator and yoga...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: From you. I'm sure it's probably nothing. But what's with the yoga already?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And Blake! All right Angela, calm down! We need to go check this out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, I'll go with you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So, uh, show us how you'd normally sell to a female client.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. With pleasure. Get ready to learn a few new tricks, old dog.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You've got this Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, you just walked into her office and begin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: May I please speak to your boss?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, she is the boss.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I am? Hmm..  [deep voice] Hi, I'm Mr. Hannon.  How can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, this isn't working for me, 'cause no one would ever believe that she would be a boss.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's absolutely right. I'm really struggling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I'll be the buyer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello, Mr. Schrute, nice to see you. Please have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I never sit down during sales  meetings. I want to appear aggressive and imposing. I am going to sell to you in twelve minutes

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No actually, she likes to take her time discussing her needs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will tell her what her needs are and then fill them. So this is going to work out best for you if you just relax and do nothing. And once I'm finished, it's over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, let's stop here. Anyone have any thoughts?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought it went great.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I have uh, written down a few questions. One, have you ever killed a woman? Two, how many women have you killed? Please, sir, will you not kill me?

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: [on phone] Okay lets get started.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm here. Are we all on?

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: Uh,, well you're the only one 'on' - we're all here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [nervous laughter] Right. Okay, uh, over the next three months...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's the winter season., three months.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I uh, I have some ideas, actually...

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: Are you at your office right now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hushed voice] Uh yeah. Trust me, I'd rather be with you guys.

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: [laughing] Uh, yeah, that sounded kinda spooky-sexy, over here Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, [clearing throat, deeper voice] Sorry, I uh... was just saying that we should uh...

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: Whoa. [laughing] I think there's been a bit of a mistake. We're trying to reach Jim Halpert, not Batman.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughing]  Um, you know what?  I.. should have just had... I should have just had you call me on my cell.

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: Uh, yeah...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna try a different spot. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: Okay, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'll call you right back.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's happening in three months?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, when you're selling to women, it is crucial that you listen, Dwight. Also you want to respect their... Are you listening now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well you have to show us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's impossible. Listening happens in the ear and in the brain. I mean, some organisms have external hairs that vibrate to indicate auditory stimulation but unfortunately, our external hairs don't vibrate at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Huh. [nodding] Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little smile and a nod shows that I hear you. Got it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kind of.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nellie, why don't you  tell Dwight what we were doing earlier today. And Dwight, you show us that you're listening.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, we were in the warehouse, where we were discussing a mural that I've commissioned Pam to paint there. We were talking  color schemes and the major themes we want to hit.  Children of the world, coming together, cutting down trees to make paper.  But not in a child labor-y way.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's just up and down, just a regular nod, like a person.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a person.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: And then we thought we'd ... I can't. I just can't  carry on with that face. Look at it. I'm gonna get nightmares with that face. I mean he looks like he's laboring over a stool having just eaten human flesh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's a bit extreme.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No, I'm sorry but that is true.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: He's screwed. They're meeting in less than an hour.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, all right. God, Dwight, just ignore every instinct you have. It's all garbage okay? You're the woman, I'm the salesman, watch what I do and try to learn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I'm a woman. [high voice] I'm a woman. Good?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ms. Thomas, so good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, are those your kids? They're so cute! They could be models.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. I'm so proud of them. I carried each one of them for nine months inside of my torso and then pushed them out of my vagina.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Booo! Weird.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, yeah. This is a lost cause. It's hopeless.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ten years ago, I didn't care if Dwight  got married or died a beet-farming bachelor.  But having kids makes you so soft. I used to watch Pulp Fiction and laugh, and now I'm like, that poor gimp is somebody's child.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, I think there could be a lot of benefits if you could learn to get along with women.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I have no problem with women. It's businesswomen and their, their power suits and their shoulder pads. Don't lie about your shoulders!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, listen to me. Businesswomen are just normal, nice, reasonable people. Who is a nice, reasonable person in your experience?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had a barber once who used to comb my hair gently.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, so, when you're selling to this woman, just imagine that she's that nice, reasonable barber.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. Good. Baby steps.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He used to fight dogs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like, he used to make dogs fight? Or he actually fought dogs?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Little of this, little of that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Which one is the instructor? There all fatties.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela! [whispering] Angela. There.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispering] On the stairs. Stay calm. Stay down. Oh, so wait. Blake is a her.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh my God! She's so stunningly tiny!  She's like a petite double zero, for sure. For sure! Holy cow! Look at what they're doing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She's repositioning his hips for downward facing dog.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [gasps] I've heard of this - dog style. Oh wait. Oh look Oscar, Thumbelina has a boyfriend! And he has a ponytail - ew. I'd like to see that run for office. Oscar, you were right. I had nothing to be worried about. Thank you. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ow.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Shut up, hold on. Shh. Hold on. Sorry. Look.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [sound effect of throwing ball]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: This is fun. You know? I mean, this is fun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What I was saying is the genius of Air Jordan was not in the market saturation, it was in --

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: [on phone] It was in what? Jim, we're having a lot of trouble hearing you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The... the... the... what I was saying is the real genius was...[car alarm blaring] was in the...

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Hey! Are those skateboarders back?

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: [on phone] Jim? Jim, are you there?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Where are they?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was, uh in the authentic design, right? So I mean, you really felt like Michael Jordan was wearing these shoes, so ...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Who was messing with my van?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nobody!

quotes.speaker: Business partner
quotes.text: [on phone]  Jordan wore them for nobody? We're not following you, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: This ends now!

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Have a seat. Um, she will be right in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, great. Oh, I'm sorry. Do you mind telling me her name? I realized we don't have it.

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Uh... um she'll be right in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to himself] Just a little off the top and then a nice combing. Yeah, just comb it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God. It's Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, dear God in heaven.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jan used to be one of my superiors, and she is one of the most erratic and terrifying people I have ever met.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [scene from Dinner Party, Season 4 and The Job Season 3]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You son of a bitch. You're firing me? Where the hell do you get off?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim and I are pretty sure she had an affair with her ex-assistant Hunter. He was 17. But she looks great. If she asks, will you tell her I said that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Forget everything we taught you.  Hey, Jan! It's so great to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Where's Wallace?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I was under the impression that David Wallace would be coming. He bought back Dunder Mifflin, correct?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Your daughter could be a bubble bath model. I could just bite her head off. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry. Um, David is in Vermont. Did you speak with him? He sent Dwight instead.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Molly! David Wallace is in Vermont.

quotes.speaker: Molly
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Um, I talked to his assistant.  And I guess it did get a little confusing  'cause you said not to tell anyone your name.  And then also, those bluetooths are very hard to hear with. I know you love the way they look, but Tom never had us use them...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Molly. I am not Tom. I am Jan.

quotes.speaker: Molly
quotes.text: I'm so sorry Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought it would be fun to have a little chat with uh, David Wallace  after all these years.  Oh, well. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listening.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Stop that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So this was all just a trick. You don't really have any business to give?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, I do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But not to us.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Insightful, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You did good, Dwight. It's okay. I mean, seriously, Jan's not normal. Let's just go. She's not going to sell to us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, she is. Now,  I may not have any instincts with women, but I have  an instinct for sales. You keep her occupied. I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm a very busy woman, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Um, do you have any other pictures of Astrid?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fine. I will show you one... slide show.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Erin, did this call...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry, I uh, just saw your face.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. It's for the thing.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know. That's great. It just - it makes it look like there's an eyebrow in the middle of your face.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A handsome eyebrow, but, um... it makes your mouth look like an eye socket... which isn't bad.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But um, you look like a cyclops whose eye... fell out... Which is great. It's such a great cause.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mommy, you're a princess. Mommy, you're a superstar. Mommy you're the greatest. How can I ever fill your sho-o-o-es?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow. Your voice is as lovely as ever.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Aw.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And it is so cute how she signs her name.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [chuckles] Well, that -- that was -- that was me too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay. It's just that's how Cece does it with the backwards 'E's.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Cece can't spell her name.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, actually she can.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, it's not really much of a comparison, is it? I mean, "Cece" is two letters and "Astrid" is... I mean, there's even some adults who -- who -- who can't spell it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Can you spell it? Try to spell it, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... "A"... "X"? I don't -- you got me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Don't patronize me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] I'm so sorry. I hate this. You're better.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [whispering] Okay, we should go now. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [stammering wildly] Just wait. Just a minute. Just watch. [scoffs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Wait. Why are you... Oh. are you getting your jollies right now? Can't get enough of the show?  Your jollies are all on fire --

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispering] Please. It's Robert who's enjoying it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This could be the affair that you're scared of. Politicians are wonderful liars. You never know who they really are. [pause] But uh, he's probably not gay. He's straight. He's straight, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm. Excuse me. Could I get some more water?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jan... You thought I had no more cards left to play. Well I've got one. Man-boy! The Ace of Babes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Where's the Quizno's?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're the Quizno's. [chuckles] Jan, may I introduce to you your own personal Dunder Mifflin liaison, devoted to servicing this account with total client satisfaction. I sensed that Molly wasn't quite meeting your needs -- nothing like, uh, your old assistant... Hunter. Was that his name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don't recall. And yes, Molly is crap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, you do not have to do this.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Do what? Get into sales? That's what I want.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's been growing that mustache for weeks. Best he can do... So young.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Will you uh, [clicks tongue] you. Can you turn around for me, please? Dwight you can go. I will call you in a week or so and let you know whether I want your business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to Clark] Do you have a valid passport?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Colin
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, it's Colin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man. I am so sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Colin
quotes.text: I know. Don't worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Colin
quotes.text: It's just... it's not totally working.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. No, I know. This whole telecommuting thing -- not ideal. But don't worry. I'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Colin
quotes.text: Yeah, well, it's not just not ideal. I mean, with you there, I don't know how we're gonna do this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, what does -- what does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar, what is happening here? Why would you say you think the senator might be gay?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know, Angela. I'm dehydrated. Maybe... You heard me wrong. We should just go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Look, look, look. Here he comes. Here he comes. What is he doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's making a phone call.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [ducking under table with Oscar] Oh. Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [phone vibrates, rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Molly. You should just quit.

quotes.speaker: Molly
quotes.text: Thanks. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh and uh, Molly... I know it can't be easy working for Jan. Good luck with your feelings.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, that was really nice. You should ask for her number.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I got her number. 415-YCL.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's a license number?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's all you need. And when I have curried favor with her, I will let you know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Why me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because you are my friend and you are a woman... And women love gossip. It's like air to you people. Ugh, God. [retching]
